title: BTS teams with Lauv for remix of Ed Sheeran-penned song
text:
BTS teams with Lauv for remix of Ed Sheeran-penned song originally appeared on goodmorningamerica.com

Following their vacation, the guys in BTS are busier than ever.

On Friday, the group will release a new version of "Make It Right," a song co-written by Ed Sheeran that appeared on their album "Map of the Soul: Persona." The new version also features Lauv.

The group retweeted Lauv's post about the song -- he's shown posing with them, along with the caption "Did I finally make it right?"

(MORE: BTS by the numbers: How their massive fandom adds up)

"You always make it right," responded BTS. The song arrives at 5 a.m. ET on Friday.

In other BTS news, the group's tour-ending performance at the Olympic Stadium in Seoul, South Korea, will be shown in movie theaters on Oct. 27.

The event, dubbed "BTS WORLD TOUR 'LOVE YOURSELF: SPEAK YOURSELF' [THE FINAL]" will be shown simultaneously across all time zones in the U.S., hours after being captured live.

It'll start at 8 p.m. ET, 5 p.m. PT and so on. Fans in Asia will be able to watch the show in theaters live.
